etymology.description: 龙/龍 (dragon) + 华/華 (flower; splendor) = “Dragon Flower,” an auspicious name extended to temples and place names.
etymology.interpretation: Common as a toponym and temple name, ultimately tied to Buddhist imagery of the “Dragon Flower” (e.g., Maitreya’s Longhua assemblies). Connotes auspiciousness, prosperity, and cultural refinement.
etymology.simplification: Both characters were simplified in the PRC to reduce strokes: 龍 → 龙 and 華 → 华, improving writing speed and readability in modern usage (especially in place names and signage).

examples.chinese: 我们参观了上海的龙华寺(我們參觀了上海的龍華寺)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen cānguānle Shànghǎi de Lónghuá Sì.
examples.english: We visited Longhua Temple in Shanghai.

examples.chinese: 深圳的龙华区发展很快(深圳的龍華區發展很快)。
examples.pinyin: Shēnzhèn de Lónghuá Qū fāzhǎn hěn kuài.
examples.english: Longhua District in Shenzhen is developing rapidly.

examples.chinese: 他住在海口市龙华区(他住在海口市龍華區)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhù zài Hǎikǒu Shì Lónghuá Qū.
examples.english: He lives in Longhua District of Haikou City.
